SEARCH
Module io.jstach.ezkv.kvs
Package io.jstach.ezkv.kvs

Interface KeyValuesMedia

All Superinterfaces:
KeyValuesServiceProvider, KeyValuesServiceProvider.KeyValuesMediaFinder
All Known Implementing Classes:
DotEnvKeyValuesMedia, JSON5KeyValuesMedia, XMLKeyValuesMedia
public interface KeyValuesMedia extends KeyValuesServiceProvider.KeyValuesMediaFinder
Represents a media type for parsing and formatting key-value pairs. A KeyValuesMedia provides parsing and formatting capabilities for specific media types and can be searched based on file extensions or media types.

Out-of-the-box implementations include properties and URL-encoded formats. The properties and URL encoded formats do maintain order of the key values parsed and do allow duplicate keys (unlike regular java.util Properties)!

Example usage for parsing an InputStream: 

KeyValuesMedia propertiesMedia = KeyValuesMedia.ofProperties();
KeyValues parsedKeyValues = propertiesMedia.parser().parse(resource, inputStream);
For a formal specification of media types see: Media Type Specifications and Registration Procedures RFC 6838

All KeyValuesMedia implement KeyValuesServiceProvider.KeyValuesMediaFinder and thus each media can be queried if it is a match of file extension of media type. When a KeyValuesSystem is fully loaded it will have a list of all found KeyValuesMedia and create a composite KeyValuesServiceProvider.KeyValuesMediaFinder.

See Also:

  • Method Details

    • getMediaType

      String getMediaType()
      Returns the media type as a string and should ideally be in rfc6838 format, is required and should be unique from other KeyValuesMedia unlike getFileExt(). For implementers if there is not a registered media type a recommendation is to use application/x-ext where "ext" would be replaced with the file extension or some name.
      Returns:
      the media type

    • getFileExt

      @Nullable String getFileExt()
      Returns the file extension associated with the media type, if any. The first period "." should not be included. For example .tar.gz should be tar.gz.
      Returns:
      the file extension or null if not applicable

    • parser

      KeyValuesMedia.Parser parser()
      Returns a KeyValuesMedia.Parser for parsing key-value pairs from an input stream.
      Returns:
      the parser

    • parser

      default KeyValuesMedia.Parser parser(Variables parameters)
      Returns a parser that maybe customized by parameters. By default parser() is called.
      Parameters:
      parameters - parameters that can come from KeyValuesResource.parameters().
      Returns:
      parser

    • formatter

      default KeyValuesMedia.Formatter formatter() throws UnsupportedOperationException
      Returns a KeyValuesMedia.Formatter for formatting key-value pairs to an appendable target. By default, this method throws UnsupportedOperationException if formatting is not supported.
      Returns:
      the formatter
      Throws:
      UnsupportedOperationException - if formatting is not supported

    • ofProperties

      static KeyValuesMedia ofProperties()
      Returns a KeyValuesMedia instance for the Properties format however unlike normal Properties order of the properties key values is maintained based on the order parsed and duplicate key names are allowed.
      Returns:
      a properties format media type

    • ofUrlEncoded

      static KeyValuesMedia ofUrlEncoded()
      Returns a KeyValuesMedia instance for the URL-encoded format.
      Returns:
      a URL-encoded format media type

      default boolean hasFileExt(String filename)

      Parameters:

      Returns:
      true if the filename ends with the media type's file extension, otherwise false
